entry.title: Welcome Peter Jan!
entry.content: Today we welcome Peter Jan Vonk as the newest member of the group! Peter Jan has a background in molecular biology of mushroom-forming fungi and will join us in the work to determine the structure and function of the germline in Marasmius oreades.

entry.title: Paper with colleagues from Czech
entry.content: After a very comprehensive and constructive review process, the paper on factors driving diversification in the cyanobacterium Microcoleus is finally published in Nature communications. Lots of genomes and lots of hard work! Read the paper here!

entry.title: Lore’s paper published
entry.content: One more piece of work from Lore’s PhD-thesis is published in Genome Biology and Evolution. Here, we present chromosome-level assemblies of the remaining species of the Podospora species complex and make an attempt to resolve their phylogenetic relationships. Lore’s work has really contributed to making Podospora a fine model system for the study of genome evolution! Read the paper here!

entry.title: Welcome Marieke!
entry.content: Marieke van der Poel started as a master student in the lab! She will delve into the genomes of Neurospora sitophila and in particular investigate spore killer resistance factors. Welcome!

entry.title: Petter halftime
entry.content: Petter successfully presented and defended his half-time PhD-report. He got very useful feedback from the external reviewer Francisco Nascimento from our home Department here at SU. Well done, Petter and thanks Frasse.

entry.title: Lore and Xi-Hui leave the group

link.title: Lore and Xi-Hui leave the group

entry.content: This week, we said farewell to Lore, who will move to France for her VR-funded postdoc work, and to Xi-Hui, who went back to China to continue working with the morels back home. Xi-Hui brought us to the best Chinese restaurant in Uppsala, so we got some good food while wishing them good fortune for the next moves!
